summary:
Award-winning IS professional with Business and Leadership acumen supported by 20+ years’ success building teams to harness existing and emerging technologies,  enhancing product delivery and customer satisfaction on global scale.

Creative, energetic, agile leader who demonstrated repeated success collaborating with IT customers across organization and PMO to align process improvements with demanding business needs and regulatory compliance standards. Outstanding written and verbal communication skills in English, Spanish and Dutch (limited) leveraged to gather requirements, gain consensus among key stakeholders at all levels of management, and motivate geographically distributed teams. Track record of identifying opportunities to accelerate quality and delivery efficiency, devising accurate forecasts and budgets, and engaging in data-driven resource allocation to optimize costs and improve bottom-line performance. 

Highlights of Expertise
•	Cross-functional Team Leadership
•	Business Process Improvement/Lean 6Sigma
•	Negotiation / Influencing
•	Program / Project Management
•	ERP Implementation
•	Stakeholders Management	
•	Supply Chain Management
•	Customer Relationship Management
•	Prioritization & Organization
•	KPI’s / Operations Stability
•	Oracle Agile Product Lifecycle Management (PLM)
•	Agile deployment methodology
•	AI, Biometrics, HoloLens, & Robots

Highly attracted by the Pharmaceutical/Biotechnology Industry to enable the digital transformation happening in all aspects of the Health industry, and to contribute to improve life of many in the world!

awards.title: 2017 Operations Innovation Award - 3rd. Place
awards.description:
Deployed Oracle Agile PLM application for AMGEN Breda, a system to manage all packages configurations for all medicines produced from Amgen Breda and shipped worldwide. 
This system is classified as Highly GMP and followed all GMP rigors supervised by QA. After all criteria’s met a successfully deployment accomplished. This project awarded me and my team with the 3rd Operation Innovation Award in 2017

awards.title: 2014 - IS Innovation Award
awards.description: BEAMPro deployed for remote engineering support manufacturing.

awards.title: 2007 Management Award – Project Magellan
awards.description: Management award recognizing IT projects/efforts required to integrate the 2 businesses, after acquisition of GE Plastics by SABIC company.

contributors.headline: Director at RedMoon Global Services Limited

profile_positions.description:
Ass. Director IT Business Partner Business Operations & Services: 
Responsible for the complete applications portfolio and demands from all business units in the Operations and Services functions: EMEA Region, while transforming from 3 ERP’s into single SAP S4/HANA ERP. In this role I’m driving efforts to streamline demands and priorities alignment to ensure successful ERP’s transformation and continued support to Hillrom growth goals. 

Product Owner/Solution Lead of the Digital Customer Engagement Product team (eDCE team): 
I expanded my role with an extra assignment to initiate the Product Teams ways of working in the IT Hillrom organisation. The Product team focused in the digital transformation of Hillrom connections with Customers: from manual to a lean automated exchange of Orders, invoices, Inventory reports, etc… Based on Agile principles, we have delivered solutions for multiple EDI demands for the Global Operations team to improve operational efficiencies, drive growth or to fulfil mandatory requirements. Some examples: 
- Germany eInvoice implemented across all Hillrom BU’s/ERP’s.
- EDI for Rental busines: new capability delivered enabling Hillrom to receive Rental Orders via EDI.
- Connected CVS pharmacy to Hillrom via API  via mobile APP to receive Orders, send ORDRSP, ASN and Invoices.
- Connecting GHX-Hillrom to receive orders via EDIFACT and eliminated mails and manual entry of orders in the ERP’s.
profile_positions.title: Ass. Director IT Business Partner for Business Operations & Services

profile_positions.description:
Provide strategic direction for supply chain management innovations with 100% alignment of supply chain IS demands and IS strategy resulting in unfailingly on-time, on-budget delivery despite challenging compliance requirements at multinational biopharmaceutical company.

IS Sr. Manager for Supply Chain / IS Innovation Leader (2016 – 2020) 
Drive ideation and implementation of leading-edge solutions based on existing and emerging technology, leading teams to deliver expected outcomes in a timely, economical manner. Gather requirements from key stakeholders at all levels and negotiate priorities to align initiatives with overarching organizational goals. Motivate and guide teams to achieve business goals, providing coaching and mentoring to foster engagement and elevate competency. Use KPIs and historical data to devise accurate forecasts for all functions related to IT investment budgets. 
•	Officially recognized for excellence in implementing AMGEN’s first high-GMP application on cloud, Oracle Agile PLM application to maintain all packaging configurations, won 3rd place, 2017 Operation Innovation Award.
•	Achieved consistent 95%+ operational stability for all critical systems supporting supply chain operations.
•	Led research and delivery of proof-of-concept for biometrics in operations, robots in warehouse operations, AI in manufacturing, and HoloLens in operations maintenance activities.
•	Deployed 18+ IT projects with proper business cases and in compliance with GMP/GDP regulations
profile_positions.title: Senior Information Technology Manager

profile_positions.description:
IS Business Partner – IS Business Partner for Supply Chain EUR & Supply Chain Breda (2014 – 2016)  Evaluated supply chain operations, researched applicable technologies, and devised robust strategies to facilitate growth and scalability. Developed broad knowledge of critical business needs and allocated resources accordingly. Facilitated GMP/GDP compliance by ensuring all new systems and enhancements met rigorous standards.
•	Introduced widely adopted demand management process to improve ability to rapidly fulfil customer needs.
•	Earned 2014 Innovation Award for deploying BEAMPro for remote engineering support in manufacturing.
•	Completed five pilot projects to propel significant business transformation involving HoloLens, artificial intelligence (AI), biometrics, and robots.
•	Enabled stability throughout GERP and EDI interaction with logistics service providers in Europe through IT architecture enhancements.
profile_positions.title: Senior Information Technology Manager

profile_positions.description: Manage IT Demand from the Polymers, Legal, EHS and SABIC Innovative Plastics business units, Europe Region.
profile_positions.title: IT Business Partner - Europe

profile_positions.description:
Manage IT demand from 3 Supply chains teams in Europe, during a period of major business structure changes and imperative cost out actions. 
Developed/implemented process to streamline demand from SC Europe to IT, assigned priorities and allocate IT resources accordingly. 33 projects deployed aligned with business priorities at minimal costs. Also IT responsible for the integration of AUTO business from two main companies SABIC Europe and Sabic Innovative Plastics(SIP) into SIP , managed to develop a cost/effective solution and enable timely lunch of the new AUTO business unit under SABIC Innovative Plastics.
profile_positions.title: Europe Supply Chain Effectiveness Leader.

profile_positions.description:
Responsible for IT Finance for SABIC Innovative Plastics, major challenge was due dates to complete all Finance TSA projects established between GE and SABIC. (example: T&L, Treasury, Taxes, many more of the GE Corporate provided services)
In cooperation with ERP team, developed ERP strategy to enable on time completion of Finance TSA projects. 
Deployed Oracle Financials r12 for the SABIC Innovative Plastics Canada business to replace existing systems owned by GE.
profile_positions.title: Global Finance IT Leader

profile_positions.description:
Responsible for IT operations/applications for Commercial team in Europe. 
Developed Global CRM strategy. Implemented Siebel CRM solution for Commercial team.
After SABIC acquisition announced I led all efforts in Europe to transform all our systems, labels, packages, etc. under the new branding name.
profile_positions.title: IT Leader Commercial Europe

profile_positions.description:
After completed Circle Team position I got a challenging position: to increase Sales Force Effectiveness from Europe Commercial team, providing them with tools/systems to maximize their performance.
Implemented Digitized Solutions for the Commercial team , increasing their efficiency.
Mobile Solution project completed. Provided Europe Sales force with business data anytime/anywhere.
profile_positions.title: Commercial Effectiveness-Digitization Leader

profile_positions.description:
Circle team positions are offered to high potential leaders within the GEPE organization to excel their leadership skills and performance by execution of Quality Improvement Projects all across GE Plastics Commercial organization, in 4 assignments of 6 months.
I completed all 4 projects and got 6sigma Black Belt Certification.
profile_positions.title: Circle Team member

profile_positions.description:
Responsible for Help Desk services  and PC procurement for GE Plastics Europe. 
Major achievement: End user services outsourced, clear SLA established with all different Service Providers and automation tools implementation for user support. Optimization and Increased service quality. On time PC procurement all across GE Plastics Europe.
profile_positions.title: IMO Leader for End–User Services - GEPE

profile_positions.description: IT responsible  to support GE Plastics business in Commercial, Technology and Marketing areas.
profile_positions.title: Commercial IT Leader

profile_positions.description: Responsible for systems support and new applications for the commercial department of GE Plastics: GE Polymerland, a division within GE Plastics Europe.
profile_positions.title: GE Polymerland IT  Leader

profile_positions.description: Responsible to support and implement IT strategy for Bacardi Martini Europe. worked with the Management Team to set/define the IT strategy aligned with business plans all across Europe offices. Selection of ERP system and implementation (JDEdwards). Also lead local teams to support the IT infrastructure and systems for the Headquarter offices, and defined infrastructure guidelines for rest of the businesses.
profile_positions.title: IT European Director

profile_positions.description:
Moved to live in the Netherlands
Studied Dutch language at Tilburg University, applied for jobs in NL.
profile_positions.title: Student of Dutch Language

profile_positions.description:
NOV ‘96– SEP ’97		Technology VicePresident Resident: 	Business Representative 
Responsible to support the Global Transactions Services of the bank (GTS): it included Securities, Trade and Cash Management areas. This was a major challenge due to the size and complexity of the business involved. During the lasts 6 months due to the absence from our Technology Manager (he was abroad) I was named fully responsible for the Technology Department in CITIBANK Venezuela.
I stop working with Citibank Venezuela after my marriage. I moved to the  Netherlands.

NOV ‘95 – SEP ’96 	Project Manager	Business Representative 	
Project Manager for two major areas: Securities and Treasury departments, decision power had increased. I had more independence on decision making and planning. I lead the implementation of main systems: SECORE and TRESTEL for Securities and Treasury departments respectively, plus planning and coordinating the implementation of any software and hardware requirement for these areas.

SEP’ 94 – NOV ’95 	Manager	   	Technology Representative 		
I interfaced with Citibank business to understand their needs and to formulate them into appropriate technical specifications for the development team (they could be local, external or global out of Venezuela). As a result of this function I was promoted and supported the globalization process of the company for two major areas: Securities and Treasury.
profile_positions.title: From Manager to Technology VicePresident Resident

profile_positions.description:
Jan’ 92 – Aug ’94 	Department Manager	
I was responsible for the support and implementation of systems for the manufacturing plants. I worked closely with the network support department to identify and to evaluate the alternatives to connect the manufacturing plants to the General Offices building. I lead and implemented the new network connection to each facility (3 remote locations) it included microwaves links and routers. I also was responsible for budget management. I defined the configuration required for the data servers in the plants, and finally I lead the purchase, installation and put into production the HP9000 computer with UNIX operating system and Oracle as RDBMS software. I lead the implementation of a system for Maintenance, Purchasing and Inventory Management for the three plants.

Jul ‘90 – Jan’ 92 	System Analyst						
I defined the need, proposed and lead the implementation of a new Payroll system for the organization, to include into the P&G processes a new acquired company: The Mammi Industries and its Manufacturing plants. 

JUL ‘89 –JUL ’90		Analyst								
Operational support of system for Payroll, Human Resources and warehouse departments. Implemented a new technology laser printer in the Central Data Center, to reduce costs, improve quality and to increase reports speed for all systems in the company.
profile_positions.title: From Analyst to Department Manager
